title: Latest iPhone 8 rumour suggests Apple's changing the headphone port AGAIN
text:
Latest iPhone 8 rumour suggests Apple's changing the headphone port AGAIN The 3.5mm headphone port was ditched for last year's iPhone 7 and this year's Lightning port could also be on the way out Share Comments By Libby Plummer 16:21, 28 FEB 2017 Updated 18:00, 28 FEB 2017 Technology Apple removed the headphone jack on the iPhone 7 (Photo: Reuters/Beck Diefenbach) Apple could be planning to drop the Lightning port from the iPhone 8 in favour of USB-C.
The Cupertino brand caused controversy last year when it ditched the traditional 3.5mm headphone port from its iPhone 7 in favour of its own Lightning connector.
The next iPhone will feature a “USB-C port for the power cord and other peripheral devices instead of the company’s original Lightning connector," according to a report in the Wall Street Journal .
While it would be a surprising and perhaps unlikely move for Apple to drops its proprietary Lightning connector from its handsets, it's not impossible.
USB-C has already been added to the Macbook range.
Read More The big Apple - futuristic new headquarters referred to as the 'flying spaceship' (Photo: Getty) However, the wording of the WSJ report suggests that USB-C will be included in the phone's charging cables rather than in the actual handset.
This would involve swapping the USB-A connector of the end of the iPhone's charging cable with a USB-C connector, as Apple has already done on its latest MacBooks.
"This would make sense, allowing users who buy the new iPhone to charge it from their new MacBook using the cable that comes in the box," says James Vincent, reporting for The Verge .
Read More Mobile World Congress 2017: The biggest announcements from this year's smartphone mega-show A visitor tries out an Apple iPhone 7 (Photo: Getty) The WSJ report also states that there will be three new iPhones this year, including a premium model designed to celebration the 10th anniversary of the iPhone.
Backing up several rumours that have previously circulated about the incoming handsets, the report also says that one of the phones will sport a curved screen, similar to the Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge.
It was also reported that Apple will ditch the physical home button on one of the three expected devices in favour of a 'function area' beneath the display.
The iPhone 8 , iPhone 8 Plus and a special edition handset are expected to be announced in September.
